s.text: As a WP editorial points out, the agents are law enforcement officers and so shouldn't be any more silent about illegal activities than say, an Arkansas state trooper.

This is key: without the ability to know what's in tap water alternatives, knowing what's in tap water isn't worth much.
The writer notes that the Times could help in this regard, since it has run stories apparently benefiting from leaked information relating to grand jury testimony.
Readers are asked at this point to observe a moment of silence.
